intro: Synaedrys fagiformis, commonly known as the boxwood tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of western North America, particularly in California and Oregon. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full sun exposure. Synaedrys fagiformis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive appearance.
